org.openstreetmap.josm.plugins.mapillary

Class MapillaryAbstractImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openstreetmap.josm.plugins.mapillary.MapillaryAbstractImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MapillaryAbstractImage>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MapillaryImage, MapillaryImportedImage

    public abstract class MapillaryAbstractImage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<MapillaryAbstractImage>
    Abstract superclass for all image objects. At the moment there are just 2, MapillaryImportedImage and MapillaryImage.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double ca
      Direction of the picture.
      protected long capturedAt
      The time the image was captured, in Epoch format.
      protected org.openstreetmap.josm.data.coor.LatLon latLon
      Position of the picture.
      protected double movingCa
      When the object direction is being moved in the map, the temporal direction is stored here

      • MapillaryAbstractImage

        protected MapillaryAbstractImage(org.openstreetmap.josm.data.coor.LatLon latLon,
                                 double ca)
        Creates a new object in the given position and with the given direction.
        Parameters:
        latLon - The latitude and longitude where the picture was taken.
        ca - The direction of the picture (0 means north).

    • Method Detail

      • getCa

        public double getCa()
        Returns the original direction towards the image has been taken.
        Returns:
        The direction of the image (0 means north and goes clockwise).

      • getCapturedAt

        public long getCapturedAt()
        Returns the Epoch time when the image was captured.
        Returns:
        The long containing the Epoch time when the image was captured.

      • getDate

        public java.lang.String getDate()
        Returns the date the picture was taken in DMY format.
        Returns:
        A String object containing the date when the picture was taken.

      • getDate

        public java.lang.String getDate(java.lang.String format)
        Returns the date the picture was taken in the given format.
        Parameters:
        format - Format of the date. See SimpleDateFormat.
        Returns:
        A String containing the date the picture was taken using the given format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter format is null

      • getLatLon

        public org.openstreetmap.josm.data.coor.LatLon getLatLon()
        Returns a LatLon object containing the original coordinates of the object.
        Returns:
        The LatLon object with the position of the object.

      • getMovingCa

        public double getMovingCa()
        Returns the direction towards the image has been taken.
        Returns:
        The direction of the image (0 means north and goes clockwise).

      • getMovingLatLon

        public org.openstreetmap.josm.data.coor.LatLon getMovingLatLon()
        Returns a LatLon object containing the current coordinates of the object. When you are dragging the image this changes.
        Returns:
        The LatLon object with the position of the object.

      • getSequence

        public MapillarySequence getSequence()
        Returns the sequence which contains this image. Never null.
        Returns:
        The MapillarySequence object that contains this MapillaryImage.

      • getTempCa

        public double getTempCa()
        Returns the last fixed direction of the object.
        Returns:

        Returns whether the image is visible on the map or not.

      • move

        public void move(double x,
                 double y)
        Moves the image temporally to another position
        Parameters:
        x - The movement of the image in longitude units.
        y - The movement of the image in latitude units.

      • next

        public MapillaryAbstractImage next()
        If the MapillaryImage belongs to a MapillarySequence, returns the next image in the sequence.
        Returns:
        The following MapillaryImage, or null if there is none.

      • previous

        public MapillaryAbstractImage previous()
        If the MapillaryImage belongs to a MapillarySequence, returns the previous image in the sequence.
        Returns:
        The previous MapillaryImage, or null if there is none.

        Set's whether the image should be visible on the map or not.
        Parameters:

      • stopMoving

        public void stopMoving()
        Called when the mouse button is released, meaning that the picture has stopped being dragged, so the temporal values are saved.

      • turn

        public void turn(double ca)
        Turns the image direction.
        Parameters:
        ca - The angle the image is moving.
